channel.title: Dynamic array value copying?
channel.description:
Can someone tell me why, arrayA[n] := arrayB[n] isn't valid but, arrayA[n] := arrayB[n] + arrayC[n] is valid and arrayA[n] := arrayB[n] + Variable is valid
I can't figure out why this is happening, but i'm getting real problems with arrayA[n] := arrayB[n] The arrays are identical lengths. It allows you to do it, but makes the program crash. When it crashes it keeps pushing to the heap, until it runs out of room.

item.title: Dynamic array value copying?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Its cus delphi sux

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic array value copying?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Hmph,

[code] SetLength(B, Length(A)); for i := 0 to High(B) do A[i] := B[i]; [/code]

Don’t see how yours wouldn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic array value copying?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Can someone tell me why,
arrayA[n] := arrayB[n] isn’t valid
but,
arrayA[n] := arrayB[n] + arrayC[n] is valid
and
arrayA[n] := arrayB[n] + Variable is valid

I can’t figure out why this is happening, but i’m getting real problems with arrayA[n] := arrayB[n]
The arrays are identical lengths.
It allows you to do it, but makes the program crash.
When it crashes it keeps pushing to the heap, until it runs out of room.

Read full topic
